page.title: 15University Student Rooms.
page.content: Inside the Hall we were first shown the Students' Common Room where they could play music, dance and sit around talking. We went up a flight of stairs and the housekeeper explained that the Hall had 75 single bedrooms and 30 double bedrooms, each with a washbasin, modern furniture and big windows opening onto a balcony. For every seven bedrooms there were baths, showers, toilets and cooking facilities. We went into two bedrooms, a single and a double one. They were both very tidy, full of books and clothes. One room even had a radio. There was a telephone in the common room for the students to use. There were six Halls of Residence on The Lawns site. They all look alike. Each Hall is cleaned daily and a housekeeper is there to help the students.
